In that case, you can create a simple web-based bulletin board system for BT device management using a web development framework like Flask (Python-based) or Express (JavaScript-based). I'll provide a basic outline for developing a Flask application. 1. Install Python and Flask: Make sure you have Python installed, and then install Flask using pip: ``` pip install Flask ``` 2. Create a new Flask application: ```python # app.py from flask import Flask, render_template, request, redirect, url_for import datetime app = Flask(__name__) # Sample data - Replace this with actual data from your company devices = [ {'device_name': 'Device 1', 'device_type': 'Headset', 'status': 'Available', 'current_owner': '', 'last_updated': ''}, {'device_name': 'Device 2', 'device_type': 'Speaker', 'status': 'Rented', 'current_owner': 'John', 'last_updated': '2023-03-26'} ] @app.route('/') def index(): return render_template('index.html', devices=devices) @app.route('/update', methods=['POST']) def update(): device_name = request.form['device_name'] status = request.form['status'] current_owner = request.form['current_owner'] # Find the device and update its status for device in devices: if device['device_name'] == device_name: device['status'] = status device['current_owner'] = current_owner device['last_updated'] = datetime.datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d') break return redirect(url_for('index')) if __name__ == '__main__': app.run(debug=True) ``` 3. Create a template for the bulletin board: ```html BT Device Management Bulletin Board

BT Device Management Bulletin Board

{% for device in devices %} {% endfor %}
Device Name Device Type Status Current Owner Last Updated
{{ device.device_name }} {{ device.device_type }} {{ device.status }} {{ device.current_owner }} {{ device.last_updated }}
``` 4. Run the Flask application: ``` python app.py ``` 5. Access the bulletin board: Open a web browser and navigate to .
